title: OJ Simpson Caught On Tape Confessing To Murders, Claims Ex-Bodyguard
content: The alleged confession was reportedly captured on a thumb drive seized from Avelli in 2022.

title: Trump's DEA Pick Chad Chronister Withdraws After Covid Criticisms
content: US President-elect Donald Trump's pick to lead the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), Chad Chronister, has withdrawn his name from consideration.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump's pick to lead the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), Chad Chronister, has withdrawn his name from consideration.

title: Donald Trump Cites Hunter Biden Pardon In Seeking Hush Money Case Dismissal
content: US President-elect Donald Trump's attorneys sought to dismiss his historic criminal fraud conviction in a new filing released Tuesday -- arguing President Joe Biden used similar reasoning to pardon his son, Hunter Biden.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump's attorneys sought to dismiss his historic criminal fraud conviction in a new filing released Tuesday -- arguing President Joe Biden used similar reasoning to pardon his son, Hunter Biden.

title: When An American Diplomat Stood Up Against Nixon-Kissinger To Save Dhaka
content: The Pakistan Air Force bombed Indian airfields, and then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared war against the enemy.

title: Donald Trump To Attend Notre Dame Reopening In Paris
content: Notre Dame cathedral will reopen in Paris on Saturday with incoming US president Donald Trump to attend the ceremony marking the resurrection of the Gothic masterpiece five years after a devastating fire.
summary: Notre Dame cathedral will reopen in Paris on Saturday with incoming US president Donald Trump to attend the ceremony marking the resurrection of the Gothic masterpiece five years after a devastating fire.

title: Forbes 30 Under 30: Leaders Redefining AI, Green Tech, And Social Media
content: These leaders, with an average age of 27 and over $3.6 billion in funding, are shaping the future through innovation, sustainability, and creative influence.

title: Watch: Asteroid On 'Collision Course' With Earth Explodes Above Russia
content: ESA in a post on X confirmed that Asteroid COWEPC5 entered Earth's atmosphere creating a fireball over the Yakutia region.
summary: ESA in a post on X confirmed that Asteroid COWEPC5 entered Earth's atmosphere creating a fireball over the Yakutia region.

title: Explained: Why South Korea Lawmakers Are Demanding President's Impeachment
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's government early Wednesday lifted martial law after a tense night of political drama at South Korea's National Assembly, lawmakers defied security forces to vote against his declaration.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's government early Wednesday lifted martial law after a tense night of political drama at South Korea's National Assembly, lawmakers defied security forces to vote against his declaration.

title: Explainer: How To Impeach A South Korean President
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is facing the threat of impeachment, with opposition lawmakers accusing him of violating his constitutional duty and committing a crime akin to treason when he declared martial law on Tuesday.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is facing the threat of impeachment, with opposition lawmakers accusing him of violating his constitutional duty and committing a crime akin to treason when he declared martial law on Tuesday.

title: This Country's President Gets A Nose Job, Lawmakers Demand Her Resignation
content: A nose job by Peruvian President Dina Boluarte sparked intense controversy on Tuesday, with some lawmakers calling for her to be removed from office for not delegating her responsibilities during the procedure.
summary: A nose job by Peruvian President Dina Boluarte sparked intense controversy on Tuesday, with some lawmakers calling for her to be removed from office for not delegating her responsibilities during the procedure.

title: Scottish Artist Jasleen Kaur Wins 2024 Turner Prize
content: Scottish artist Jasleen Kaur won the prestigious Turner Prize on Tuesday, as the UK contemporary art award celebrated its 40th anniversary.
summary: Scottish artist Jasleen Kaur won the prestigious Turner Prize on Tuesday, as the UK contemporary art award celebrated its 40th anniversary.

title: US Man Shot Dead By Police After He Threatens To Kill Daughter
content: A seven-year-old Ohio girl pleaded with her father not to harm her during a tense standoff with police, saying, "I don't want to go to heaven today."
summary: A seven-year-old Ohio girl pleaded with her father not to harm her during a tense standoff with police, saying, "I don't want to go to heaven today."

title: What Is Presidential Pardon And Its Use In The US
content: Outgoing US President Joe Biden on Sunday pardoned his son, Hunter, for any federal crimes "he committed or may have committed" between January 1, 2014, and December 1, 2024.
summary: Outgoing US President Joe Biden on Sunday pardoned his son, Hunter, for any federal crimes "he committed or may have committed" between January 1, 2014, and December 1, 2024.

title: Joe Biden Announces $1 Billion In Aid For African Countries
content: The United States will provide more than $1 billion in humanitarian aid for people displaced by drought or conflict in 31 African countries, US President Joe Biden said in Angola Tuesday.
summary: The United States will provide more than $1 billion in humanitarian aid for people displaced by drought or conflict in 31 African countries, US President Joe Biden said in Angola Tuesday.

title: Martial Law, Then A Reversal: How South Korea's Night Of Chaos Unfolded
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol shocked the country and declared martial law on Tuesday night, but backtracked hours after lawmakers defied security forces to vote against his declaration and thousands of protesters took to the streets.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol shocked the country and declared martial law on Tuesday night, but backtracked hours after lawmakers defied security forces to vote against his declaration and thousands of protesters took to the streets.

title: Meta Seeks New Nuclear Reactors To Run US Data Centers
content: Meta said on Tuesday it is seeking proposals from nuclear power developers to help meet its artificial intelligence and environment goals, becoming the latest big tech company to take interest in atomic power amid an expected boom in power demand.
summary: Meta said on Tuesday it is seeking proposals from nuclear power developers to help meet its artificial intelligence and environment goals, becoming the latest big tech company to take interest in atomic power amid an expected boom in power demand.

title: South Korean President Withdraws Martial Law After Lawmakers Defy Him
content: President Yoon Suk Yeol's shock bid to impose South Korea's first martial law in over four decades plunged the country into the deepest turmoil in its modern democratic history.
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol's shock bid to impose South Korea's first martial law in over four decades plunged the country into the deepest turmoil in its modern democratic history.

title: Rapper Eminem's Mother Dies Aged 69 After Lung Cancer Battle
content: Rapper Eminem's mother Debbie Nelson has passed away. She was 69.

title: South Korea Withdraws Martial Law. What Happens Next
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Wednesday said he would lift martial law just hours after he imposed it, in a brief and confusing episode in which he blasted the opposition as "anti-state forces" threatening the country's democracy.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Wednesday said he would lift martial law just hours after he imposed it, in a brief and confusing episode in which he blasted the opposition as "anti-state forces" threatening the country's democracy.

title: At UN, US And Russia At Loggerheads Over Rebel Offensive In Syria
content: Russia and the United States clashed at the United Nations on Tuesday, accusing each other of supporting terrorism during a Security Council meeting convened over a sudden escalation of fighting in Syria.
summary: Russia and the United States clashed at the United Nations on Tuesday, accusing each other of supporting terrorism during a Security Council meeting convened over a sudden escalation of fighting in Syria.
